alert.note: Alert for Boone; Clay; Hendricks; Montgomery; Owen; Parke; Putnam (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 12:29AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Hendricks, central Clay, northwestern Owen, southeastern Parke, southwestern Boone, southern Montgomery and Putnam Counties through 100 AM EDT... At 1229 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Crawfordsville to 9 miles east of Rockville to 12 miles south of Brazil. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Crawfordsville around 1235 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Greencastle. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 between mile markers 23 and 44. Interstate 74 between mile markers 36 and 50. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Boone; Clay; Hendricks; Montgomery; Owen; Parke; Putnam
